intro: Beccariella schlechteri, commonly known as the Bornean beccariella, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
